item.title: High-speed mech action game Project Six for PC officially titled OMEGA PHENEX COMMENCED PROJECT SIX
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gematsu.com/2024/12/high-speed-mech-action-game-project-six-for-pc-officially-titled-omega-phenex-commenced-project-six

  • PC

From independent Japanese developer Surume Koubou.

High-speed mech action game Project Six is officially titled OMEGA PHENEX COMMENCED PROJECT SIX, independent Japanese developer Surume Koubou announced. It will be available for PC via Steam when it launches. A release date has not been announced.

Here is an overview of the game, via its Steam page:

About

You will become a pilot of the mech “Icarus,” which has tremendous maneuverability. You will enjoy a fight and face large powerful armies and rivals by moving from skimming the surface of the sea to the cloud with Icarus. This game is a high-speed mech shooting game capable of firing massive amounts of missiles.

Key Features

  • Immerse Yourself in Tactile Mech Action at Overwhelming Speeds
    • This work is characterized by an overwhelming sense of speed. There are no restrictions on turning speed, and the consumption of the boost gauge required for high-speed movement and flight is set to a moderate level. Enemy bullets are easy to avoid, making it easy to enjoy high-speed combat.
    • Aim controls follow those of general shooting games such as FPS and TPS, so that even those unfamiliar with robot games will find the game easy to play.
  • Mechanical Customization System for Both Appearance and Performance
    • It also features the mech’s customization functions, such as changing parts and painting capabilities. The performance of each part varies slightly, but the performance of the mechs is largely determined by the “Tune” function. This “Tune” can be used to enhance any parameter of your choice, such as durability value, mobility, or weapon performance by spending a limited predefined amount of the cost.
    • This allows you to customize your mechs’ to your preferred appearance while pursuing your preferred fighting style.
  • More Than 30 Missions, Plus an “Arena Mode” for One-on-One Battles
    • The game includes a wide variety of missions, such as extermination, exploration missions, boss battles and escort missions (we are considering a less stressful specification for the escort missions). In addition, there is an “Arena Mode” for one-on-one combat with the enemy “Icarus.”

item.title: Multiplayer hide and seek game Witch It now available for PS5
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gematsu.com/2024/12/multiplayer-hide-and-seek-game-witch-it-now-available-for-ps5

  • PS5

Previously released for PC.

Barrel Roll Games has released multiplayer hide and seek game Witch It for PlayStation 5 via PlayStation Store for $19.99, the developer announced.

Witch It first launched in Early Access for PC via Steam on May 31, 2017, followed by a full release alongside Epic Games Store on October 22, 2020.

Here is an overview of the game, via Barrel Roll Games:

About

Witch It is a multiplayer hide and seek game set in a vibrant, magical world. Brave hunters seek hidden witches that curse their villages!

A Vibrant, Magical World Awaits

Explore and hide within humble villages, exotic islands, and peculiar forests brimming with secrets and surprises for you to discover. Each map contains a variety of prop arrangements, keeping matches unique and exciting every time you play!

Seek as a Fearless Hunter

Hunters are tasked with seeking pesky witches hidden throughout the map. Mix and match an array of different tools and abilities to help detect, trap or slow down witches as well as traverse the map effortlessly!

Hide as a Mischievous Witch

Witches can mimic any physical object in the landscape to fool the hunters and survive. Found by a hunter? Don’t worry—use a spell to fly, disorientate, or distract them away from your hiding spot while you escape!

Props, Props, Props

At first glance, that book on the shelf may look innocent, but remember: witches can disguise themselves as any physical object. Glorious rewards await the most curious of witches who can find and mimic all props!

Earn Rewards and Express Yourself

Personalize your characters with hundreds of stylish shirts and wacky brooms. Unlock magnificent costumes from simply playing and leveling up, or try out our crafting system to forge a specific item, ingredient or rarity!

A Game Mode for Everybody

  • Hide and Seek – The standard Witch It gameplay. Witches must survive the time limit before the hunters catch them!
  • Mobification – Faster-paced gameplay. Eliminated witches join the hunter team!
  • Hunt a Hag – All skills and projectiles are disabled. A one-way game of tag!
  • Fill a Pot – Our two-versus-two competitive experience. Witches must fill cauldrons with specific props before the time runs out, or before they lose all lives!

item.title: Short animated novel OneRoom: Yui Hanasaka Memorial announced for PC
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gematsu.com/2024/12/short-animated-novel-oneroom-yui-hanasaka-memorial-announced-for-pc

  • PC

Due out on January 11, 2025 for 500 yen.

Publisher Laplacian and developer Sakasauma have announced OneRoom: Yui Hanasaka Memorial, an animated novel game allowing players to reexperience the story of short anime series OneRoom‘s main heroine, Yui Hanasaka. It will launch for PC via Steam on January 11, 2025 for 500 yen with English, Japanese, Traditional Chinese, and Simplified Chinese language support, and features 15 to 20 minutes of total play time.

The staff of OneRoom have also reunited to launch the new project, “PROJECT OneLeaf.” A new animation studio, “STUDIO OneRoom,” has been established to produce a completely new anime that continues from the previous series, as well as produce original content under the concept of “creating together with fans” through new forms of announcements and user participation projects.

Here is an overview of the game, via its Steam page:

About

That pure love, that lovey-dovey moment again—.

A brand-new project from the beloved short anime series OneRoom has begun!

Introducing “PROJECT OneLeaf,” a completely new project where you can once again experience the story of the main heroine, Yui Hanasaka (voiced by MAO), from the OneRoom series in an innovative animated novel game!

About the OneRoom Series

The OneRoom series is known for its subjective viewpoint, where the viewer themselves is the protagonist, and it features special days spent with the heroines.

The series is in an omnibus format and depicts the unique and intimate relationships between the protagonist and the heroines. The first season aired in 2017, the second in 2018, and the third in 2020.

With charming characters by popular illustrator Kantoku, stunning animation, a story more profound than one might expect from a short anime, and meticulous attention to fetishistic details, the series became a huge hit.

Yui Hanasaka’s Story

Yui Hanasaka is the only heroine to appear in all seasons of the OneRoom series.

In the first season, she moves to Tokyo for her university entrance exams and meets the protagonist (you), who is her neighbor in the same apartment. Their bond grows as they spend special days together, and they eventually fall in love.

In the second season, we follow their lives as university students and lovers. Though they argue and face insecurities, their relationship strengthens.

In the third season, the couple faces a major turning point as they transition into working adults.

In this game, you can revisit the story from the second season and experience the third season’s events.

Key Features

  • A new type of animated novel game that directly adapts the original anime. It combines subjective viewpoint animation with novel game elements, creating a higher level of immersion.
  • Includes new monologues written by the original anime scriptwriter, giving you the chance to experience Yui’s emotions and enjoy the story from a different perspective than the anime.
  • As a clear reward, you can view precious materials such as concept art, illustration collections, and original sketches.
  • The game is a short story with a total playtime of 15 to 20 minutes.
  • The game also serves as an experimental project designed to expand the possibilities of the new project. We encourage players who are interested to provide feedback and support the future of the project.
  • We permit the streaming of gameplay videos, but kindly ask that you refrain from sharing clear reward videos or images.
